problem_text:
Prove an analogue of Higman’s theorem for the Burnside variety Bn of groups of odd exponent n ≫ 1, that is, prove that every recursively presented group of exponent n can be embedded in a finitely presented (in Bn) group of exponent n.
S. V. Ivanov
answer: It is proved (A. Yu. Olshanskii, J. Algebra, 560 (2020), 960–1052).
